note: Litigation Commercial Litigation As Delaware's United States Attorney for more than seven years, Mr.
title: Connolly, former United States Attorney for Delaware, is a member of Morgan Lewis's Litigation Practice and the managing partner of the firm's Wilmington office. Mr. Connolly's practice focuses on practice areas complex commercial and intellectual property litigation, white collar criminal matters, and corporate investigations

container-title: During his tenure as an Circuit Assistant United States Attorney, Mr. Connolly also prosecuted the first U.S. District Court for the District of federal criminal civil rights case in Delaware history and received from the Delaware Department of Justice the Director's Award for Superior Performance as an Assistant United States Attorney. Mr. Connolly obtained his J.D., with honors, from Duke University School of Law in 1991, where he was an editor for the journal Law & Contemporary Problems and received the school's top oral advocate award
note: After law school, he served as a law clerk to Judge Walter K. Stapleton of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit. He received his M.Sc. from the London School of Economics in 1987 and his B.A., with honors, from the University of Notre Dame in 1986. Mr. Connolly is admitted to practice in Delaware and before the U.S. Supreme Court, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third Circuit, and U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware.
title: Government Connolly managed all federal criminal prosecutions and the legal Investigations representation of the departments and agencies of the federal government in all civil matters filed in Delaware courts. Mr. Connolly has tried dozens of FCPA/Anticorruption cases in federal and state courts and has argued numerous cases before the IP Litigation U.S. Courts of Appeals for the Second and Third Circuits. He has handled a Antitrust broad range of subject matters, including complex contractual and patent Cartel Investigations & Litigation: disputes, theft of trade secrets, export control violations, healthcare and Criminal & Civil corporate fraud investigations, RICO litigation, environmental and antitrust offenses, and FDA regulatory violations. bar admissions Mr. Connolly gained national recognition as an Assistant United States Delaware Attorney for leading the multi-agency investigation into the disappearance of the secretary to the governor of Delaware. The investigation resulted in the court admissions indictment of Thomas Capano, a prominent lawyer in the state, on murder charges. After a three-and-one-half month jury trial, Mr. Connolly and his U.S. Supreme Court team obtained a first-degree murder conviction despite the absence of a U.S. Court of Appeals for the Third body, murder weapon, or witness to the killing
